title: 2 Easy Ways to Put a Password on a Microsoft Word Document

steps.title: Open a document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a document in Microsoft Word. This looks like a W on top of a blue square. Microsoft Word is available to install for Windows . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You must have a subscription to use Office 365.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This will be at the top-left corner of the window, next to Home . A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Info.
steps.content: Click Info . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Protect Document.
steps.content: Click Protect Document . This is the first tile of the Info tab. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Set as Read-Only (optional).
steps.content: Set as Read-Only (optional). If you want to prevent accidental changes from others when you share a document , you can set it as "Read-Only". Keep in mind that others will be able to change this mode if they choose. Click Always Open Read-Only in the drop-down menu. You'll see an icon of a pencil and cancel symbol underneath Protect Document . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Encrypt with Password.
steps.content: Click Encrypt with Password . This will be below Always Open Read-Only . A pop-up box will open.

steps.title: Enter a password and click OK.
steps.content: Enter a password and click OK . Keep in mind you won't be able to reset or recover the password if you forget it. Be sure to use a password you can remember . Passwords, starting with Word 2013 to the current version, can be no longer than 13 characters long.

steps.title: Re-enter the password and click OK.
steps.content: Re-enter the password and click OK . Input the same password as the previous step. [4] X Research source You should now see a lock and key icon underneath Protect Document .

steps.title: Close the document.
steps.content: Close the document. If you're prompted to save your document , be sure to save. When you open the document again, you'll be asked to enter in your password. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open a document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a document in Microsoft Word. This looks like a W on top of a blue square. Microsoft Word is available to download for macOS. You must have a subscription to use Microsoft Word and Office 365.

steps.title: Click Review.
steps.content: Click Review . This is the tab at the top, next to View .

steps.title: Click Protect.
steps.content: Click Protect . The icon will look like a padlock in front of a document. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Protect Document.
steps.content: Click Protect Document . The Password Protect window will open. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter a password.
steps.content: Enter a password. You can set a password to open the document and to modify the document. Keep in mind you won't be able to retrieve this password, so use a password you can remember. To mark the document as read only, check the box for Read-only recommended .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This is the blue button at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Close the document.
steps.content: Close the document. If you're prompted to save your document, be sure to save. When you open the document again, you'll be asked to enter in your password.
